newsitem.title: USA: Olicom A/S to buy CrossComm for cash and stock.
newsitem.headline: Olicom A/S to buy CrossComm for cash and stock.

text.p: Olicom A/S, a Danish company that produces equipment for computer networking, said Friday it was acquiring CrossComm Corp., which makes complementary products, in a cash and stock transaction worth at least $61 million.

Olicom, whose shares are traded on the Nasdaq market, agreed to acquire each of CrossComm's 9.3 million outstanding shares for $5 cash, 0.2667 Olicom share and a three-year warrant. Olicom's stock was unchanged at $14.75 in late morning trading on Nasdaq.
The warrant would equal a right to acquire 0.1075 Olicom share at $19.74 per full share, the company said.

Olicom added that the acquisition, to be accounted for using purchase accounting, will result in Olicom recognising a "significant" non-recurring charge in order to write off in-process research and development and other acquisition expenses.
It did not provide a specific figure.
CrossComm, which is based in Marlboro, Mass., manufactures high-performance networking products such as routers and high-speed switches, primarily for mainframe computers.
Its shares fell 75 cents to $7.875, also on Nasdaq.
